question: 日光
sourceMnemonic: You have <kanji>sun</kanji> <kanji>light</kanji>. What kind of light would this be? Obviously <vocabulary>sunlight</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since the <ja>にち</ja> reading of <ja>日</ja> becomes <ja>にっ</ja> here, we've made a mnemonic for you to remember this reading:

The best place for <vocabulary>sunlight</vocabulary> in Japan is <reading>Nikkō</reading> (<ja>にっこう</ja>). It's one of Japan's most beautiful national parks, and the perfect spot to catch some rays!
